headline: Engineer II
pros: Edge rotation program is good
cons: Compensation is a bit too social (i.e. not enough separation for good performance)

headline: Dissappointed
pros: Small patches of the company had really great and innovative people.
cons: Middle management structure was stifling to anything productive. Anyone with good work ethic and good ideas was immediately viewed as a threat and fed to the BSC political machine.

headline: Great Benefits and Pay.  Need to right the ship for turnaround story.
pros: Great Salary, Benefits and Bonus Program.  Products provide benefits to society.
cons: Yearly layoffs, plant shutdowns, restructuring.  Stock struggling to meet expectations.  So big lots of people 'hiding'.  Limited growth opportunities - staffed to have more projects than are funded - perhaps layoffs have solved this by now.

headline: Phenomenal company with sales management.
pros: Quality training and products.  Boston has been a market leader in medical devices for a long time.  They have a number of divisions, so the potential to remain with the organization for a lifetime is very realistic.  They take care of their employees.
cons: Like most companies, Boston was not without its challenges.  The organization has worked tirelessly to overcome them however.  Whether it be an FDA warning letter, or product issues, the company is relentless in correcting the situation and moving forward.

headline: A business centered environment
pros: Lots of opportunity for learning and progression within the company if you have the education required.
cons: Many managers don't care about their employees careers and rely heavily on HR to manage all hiring aspects.

headline: CRM OK place to be, but could be better
pros:
Poised to take back CRM market share with superior technology.
Company focus on expanding markets.
cons:
Takes time for market to respond to promises about longevity of CRM products
Global arbitrage has hidden quality costs.
Lots of talent left the company over the past 5-7 years.

headline: Fast paced, good people, great opportunities, tough market situation
pros:
Good team and collaboration between functions
Improving leadership, new CEO
Amazing impact on patient lives
Great opportunities for career advancement or cross-functional opportunities
cons:
Revenue slipping in core businesses
Tough tax and regulatory environment impacting bottom-line
Lay offs and outsourcing have been used to help meet stock market expectations
Stock has plateaued at a historically low level

headline: Great company to work for if your correct division.
pros: Products, people and sales force.  Top notch.
cons: Upper management, CEO CFO comp is absurd, way to top heavy, too many VP's.  RIF's are always field based while VP's are added.  No equity or rev. Share programs like competitors in this field.

headline: Stop looking outside and overseas
pros: Good people, some good products
cons: No growth.  Too many jobs outsourced contractors aren't trained well enough to do the job. Management is about quantity and quality gets lost. Too much favoritism.

headline: Working at Boston Scientific
pros: Depending on who you work for/with, Boston Scientific can be a great place to work! The cafeteria is good and gym has lots to offer.
cons: The morale overall is low, layoffs abound. After 10 years, this is the 3rd executive management regime and with every regime, the last 2 administrations never walked around the home office to meet the little "people" (the folks who do all the work! There are lots of changes (not all changes are good!). Raises have been less than 3% for the past 3 years and bonuses are given to the "most important" positions.

headline: Kind of your average company.
pros: Big Company.  Product pipeline in 2 years looks pretty good.
cons: Big Company.  Currently offers 5 fewer vacation days to start then Medtronic (10 days versus 15).  My biggest ding on benefits are if you max out your 401K before the end of the year, the company starts matching.  Say you sell a little extra in November and make more commissions.  No 401K match on your last check.  Say you need to adjust down your 401K contribution.  It takes multiple pay cycles to process and can miss part of your match.  There have been slow benefit erosions too.  I don't see that changing for a while until the economy creates employee retention programs again.  Their biggest product downfall was their inability to correctly predict price erosion in the stent market.

headline: Great Culture
pros: The people - at all levels. The Executive Team is always striving to put out the best new products, with the highest quality, in the shortest amount of time.
cons: There are definitely some people that need to move on as they have definitely overstayed their effectiveness.  Also, without some recognition by the stock market for all of the new innovations that get launched each year, there will always be a "small man" complex.

headline: Good People, terrible mgmt
pros: Good job with good team
cons: Management has no idea where this company is going

headline: Great Products, People, Innovation.....POOR Management!
pros: Most innovative and customer centric products on the market.
cons: No direction, leadership or at the senior levels.

headline: Good company to work for
pros: Nice work environment for employees
cons: Work long hours as a salaried employee

headline: Boston Scientific has provided me with many opportunities and a wealth of knowledge.
pros: A lot of opportunities for those that are willing to learn and can catch on to processes quickly.
cons: Hard to change or take a different approach to company policies.

headline: Good working environment, but questionable management.
pros: Competitive pay and benefits.  People are very friendly overall.
cons: Poor management, especially at the corporate level.

headline: Good, but you need to advocate for yourself
pros:
Good work/life balance, great co workers, 

The product made save lives, and that feels great.
cons: Very top heavy and constant lay offs and re-organizations make the company seem unstable.  We 4th CEO in 5 years started recently adding to this. Pay is average, it is good to keep an open eye ot postings to move up.

headline: Competitive, high demand atmosphere where demand keeps increasing
pros: Ability to work on a variety of tasks on a variety of projets allow for good networking and relationship development.
cons: Extremely high workload that is due to an extremely high demand.  Networking and relationship building is more difficult than in the past due to the numerous reductions and offshoring.  Morale is at an all time low right now.

headline: Great people, poorly managed.
pros: The employees at this plant really do create a sort of family.
cons: Ever since the lifting of the FDA 483 and the Guidant settlement, the work environment has been more fickle.

headline: Boston Scientific - World Class Medical Device Manufacturing
pros: Learned how to manufacture device at a world class level.  Lean intensive.
cons: Quality systems, while compliant, could be described at overly conservative.

headline: Great company but  bad management
pros: flex work, benefits, location, work, products
cons: management, management, management, management, management

headline: Uber Competitive. Consulting Firm Atmosphere.
pros:
Favorites are rewarded with bonuses and promotions.
Make a difference in the lives of patients
Good Commute - not in city
Excellent cafeteria food. Free Parking.
Good culture for politicians.
cons:
Management identifies "scape goats" early in career and blames them for when projects are not set up to succeed. Management does not take accountability at all. Ultimately scape goats are put into an HR corrective action and fired.

Even if you are identified as a good steady performer then it is a matter of time before you get laid off. They only want to keep the top 35% of the work force.

Overtime is expected without compensation.
You are expected to "volunteer" for extra work and if you do not then you will get a bad review. 
Favortism is the mantra of management. Not objective performance. 

No....I am not just lashing out. This is an honest review. Just ask someone who works there.

headline: Engage your workforce
pros:
Great coworkers
Good Benefits including short time required to become fully vested for 401k
Decent Salary
cons:
Morale of employees
Upper Management disengagement
"Lean Team" which did not understand the concept of lean or the flow of the areas.
Forcing mandatory OT on short notice which ended up happening on holiday weekends and over holiday break.

headline: Headed in the wrong direction for too long
pros: There are still some interesting technologies to be a part of that impact patients in very positive ways but the red tape and poor direction at this company are difficult to overcome.
cons: Shrinking benefits, multiple RIFs, and annual re-organizations make this a company to avoid

headline: Typical large, multi layered company
pros: Large product portfolio and intellectual property
cons: Are not customer focussed that has gotten them burned... focus on 90 day windows so the management can make their bonus

headline: senior supplier quality engineer
pros: good salary, and   good coworkers
cons: remote location, and high turnover

headline: Smart people, interesting work
pros:
Great people to work with 
Tons of training is encouraged
Movement within the company is encouraged
Pay / benefits are good
cons:
Layoff culture
Upper management out of touch
People promoted because they have put in their time, not because they are the best person
Communication is poor
Dictates from Natick that don't fit the local business model

headline: analytical chemist
pros: good company to work, great enviroment, good benefit. I love to work there. I learn a great deal working at Boston Scientific. I have been treated very well.
cons: strugle with ecomic down size. Company try to save cost, reduce head count in future

headline: Good people to work with and good lower management, but it is starting to feel like a death spiral.
pros: Many of the people are very knowledgeable and easy to work with.  The pay is pretty good and the benefits are still good though that is changing.  Work-life balance can be a plus depending on where you are positioned.
cons: The company has been going through yearly layoffs, and it seems like they will continue.  The medical device industry as a whole is going down, and the stock price has followed.  I don't see much opportunity for growth here in the future.

headline: Corporate structure
pros:
Good exposure to engineering and busniess systems
Good principles 
Some oppurtunities
cons: Cog in a wheel syndrome. Risk adverse, lots of waste. Slow product development.

headline: Employees are not a priority at Boston Scientific
pros:
Pay... Was ok but was the only thing they could compete on. 
Middle mgmt was still trying... Staff too,  but too many Directors and VP's promoted for political reasons rather than ability.
cons:
Career development is limited to the two weeks before your review where managers exchange barbs in a race to define the bottom 15%. 
HR is a joke.   Completely outsourced and incompetent.   Payroll errors,  benefits errors that went on for months with little care for the impact to the employee

headline: No vertical movement
pros: The people are fun. The products are life saving. The benefits are many.
cons: There is no vertical movement in the company. Most people end up in the same job year after year after year. You take on more and more work, and you do get bonuses and raises, but no change in job titles.

headline: US jobs abandoned
pros: Pay, work conditions and benefits
cons: Boston scientific abandoned the US workers in Miami. They moved the facility to Costa Rico. Previous senior management made a bad investment in Guidant.

headline: senior engineer quality
pros: work life balance, cares about employees, includes employees
cons: rounds of layoff depending on state of company

headline: Accountant
pros:
The job is well plan and organized.
The boss is clear in assinging tasks and responsabilites.
The tools and job location is fully equiped and up to date.
cons:
Your carreer will be conditioned for offsore starategic decisions not related with your performance.
The human resources department is secretive and arbitrary.

headline: Every changing enviroment, competitive good people very corporate centered.
pros: Lots of Training opportunities for soft skills like leadership and person to person relationships.  Not so much training on products.
cons: The more desirable benefits like child care and weight watchers clubs and others types of employee engagement programs are centered around the Minnesota and Massachusetts sites.

headline: Average company, uncertain future in medical devices field
pros: Manufacture high quality products, solid clinical data to back reliability of devices.  Has a solid image among customers.
cons: Too slow to produce new products to keep competitive in tough market, feels like support is very limited for field workers.

headline: Tough place to work
pros: Highly intelligent staff. Many dedicated people. Company trying to become more efficient.
cons: Extensive changes have created a difficult atmosphere of too much work and not enough resources.

headline: Great peers, lackluster managers
pros: Outstanding work-life balance.  There's a belief in not working too much and that it's just a job.  Additionally, in my experience, I found that my peers had the drive and creativity to market sub-par products in a crowded space.  Average benefits across med-tech companies.
cons:
Stagnation and mediocrity are acceptable part of the culture, so if you are a hard charger, you won't fit in.  When management skills (leadership, driving the business, creativity)  in this company are compared to managers in other companies, BSC managers are sub-par.
Culture is stuck in the 1990s, during the good old days.  Hey, guess what, it's a different ball game, but the company hasn't changed with the times

headline: Great company to work for.
pros: Talented colleagues along with great salary and benefits .
cons: Company is in constant state of change.

headline: Great great middle management
pros: Open enviroment, great people and lots of knowledge
cons: Being young and enthusiastic you don't get recognized for your great ideas...all good ideas get thrown in a pot leaving individuals feeling like part of a machine

headline: In house experience was good.  Field experience has been frustrating.
pros: In house people at CRM truly are excellent at their technoloy and professsions.
cons: The fact that there is always a pending layoff that looms over both in-house and field employees can be detrimental to creating strong teams and developing a sense of job security.  This is not just BSC-  the same goes for StJ and MDT as well.

headline: Maybe I was lucky and had the best boss in the place but I never leared more at BSC than at any other company
pros: Paid well, facilities were very nice, many opportunities if you wanted to change departments
cons: having issues determining where they want to go and who should lead - bit surprosed by adoption of Guidant processes - didnt appear completely thought out and appeared to be the goal of only a few middle/upper management (most of whom left the company during and immediately following the changes)

headline: Beware
pros:
Good Benefits
Great Campus with access to parks and onsite health/fitness/banking facilities.
Best direct (middle) management that I have every worked with.
My peers are some of the most talented and friendliest people that I have ever worked with.
cons:
Pay was ok, but is no longer competitive with the market
The atmosphere feels like they are getting ready for a fire sale.
Issues that were deemed necessary in past years are no longer being addressed.
Attrition, for key roles, is occurring at an alarming rate and they are not replacing head count.
The atmosphere is slowing going from "Why is nobody caring!?" to "Meh, I guess if upper management doesn't care, I don't care either. Time to look for a new job".

headline: Excellent products, hated MA
pros:
Medical devices that help patients
Extremely smart colleagues
Excellent pay and benefits
cons:
Huge organization, so lots of politics
Hated living in MA

headline: Lots of autonomy and freedom in your schedule yet many external factors affect sales performance
pros: Great compensation package. Uncapped earnings with commission. Lots of Autonomy. High level sales.
cons: External industry factors affect performance such as decreasing reimbursement and negative patient outcomes

headline: Lots of potential & lots of dissapointment
pros:
-Good pay & benefits
-Good work/life balance
-Good products with very promising future potential
-Global market reach
cons:
-Last few years has been a revolving door of CEO's.  When Mahoney takes over in November, he will be the 4th CEO in 4 years.
-Company tries to buy growth rather than develop it internally.  They also claim that "we spend a $1 billion a year on R&D", even though we do not.  Company hasn't spent that much on R&D in years.  In fact, R&D spend has declined consistently for several years - just take a look at the P&L's.  
-BSC is the only major medical device company that is not growing.  Check the sales of MDT, ABT, STJ and you'll see what I mean.
-As a reult of no growth...company struggles to turn a profit, meanwhile competitors are making money hand over fist.  Again, just take a look at the P&L's.

headline: Great People - Upper Management Just OK
pros: The people were great.  Work-life balance was easy to achieve as the workload was not unreasonable.
cons: The upper management does not seem to have a great vision of the future.  Too many layoffs.  The stock price has been floundering for a few years, which is not great for the 401 plan!

headline: Well compensated company, good opportunity and development especially for sales force
pros: Good hygiene benefits, strong systematic system replenishment, strong sales force
cons: Not very intergrated communication and information sharing between upstream and downstream communication. Management lack of focus and respect for support functional that is crucial to supoprt the business.

headline: A Place to Make a Difference
pros:
There is an opportunity to really make a difference in the world
The company provides meaningful work and rewards
Strong pay and benefits
Good work locations and facilities
cons:
There has been lots of change and uncertainty
The financial performance has been weak for some time and there is an uncertain outlook
There has been high turnover especially among senior leadership
Leadership is lacking focus and consistency

headline: Many growth opportunities in different areas of medical device
pros: Most people are great to work with and care about patients
cons: Many changes occuring and management shifts

headline: Boston Scientific is a great place to work.
pros: Great culture, commitment to quality, great people.
cons: Long product development timelines, heavy SOP's.

headline: Good then went downhill as times got tough.
pros: Interesting industry, great people, good pay
cons: cut throat, RIFs all the time, constant change in higher management, lack of recognition of talent at lower levels

headline: Ok place to work
pros: BSC makes products that help people and is a huge company with excellent benefits and fair wages, Hopefully they can maintain competitiveness and continue innovating.
cons: You really have to play politics and fight for recognition.not alot of reward or recognition at individual employee level

headline: Boston Sci A good start in the Medical Field
pros: A lot of good systems already established, the salary and compensation packages were better but are still better than most other companies. The product depth is makes the company stable.
cons: Management can yes you to death, agree in theory, but never actually take actions.  It can leave employees a little lost with that type of leadership.  Senior Management still can not admit they purchased other companies and did paid too much. The due diligence process did not work properly and every stockholder and employee paid the price.  Until they can admit to errors they will have trouble growing.

headline: Stay away from IT if you believe in Quality!
pros: Not much comes to mind since BSC bought Guidant.  Guidant gave you bragging rights... BSC does not.
cons:
Might be a good company to work at areas other than IS, alas I had not the opportunity to experience.  Our new IT motto is "Don't care for quality, save a dime".  Problem is we're making devices implented in people's bodies, not lemonade!

Crude language is tolerated.  Respect is not present.

headline: A fairly decent place to work
pros: The Pay is the best part.
cons: The system of promotion is not what it should be.

headline: Local experience has been very good, corporate headquarters the opposite
pros: Good opportunities to learn about the CRM business and develop relationships with business staff.  Local customers are great to work with and very appreciative of our efforts.
cons: Very poor management at headquarters, out of touch with reality, no concept of people management, no leaders, no strategy.

headline: Great products, industry going through change and that's reflected in the company's direction
pros: the company still attracts great people, who are fun, talented and care about the products they make.  Flexibility in work fairly good.   Great products, its rewarding to see those that receive the products and see  how their lives are improved.
cons: not alot of reward or recognition at individual employee level.  Decisions made in Corporate based on short term financial reasons,  there is a continual  fear of job instability, lay-offs and lack of career potential so that hampers employees too--too bureaucratic.

headline: Good place to work, but isn't exactly exciting
pros: BSC makes products that help people and is a huge company with excellent benefits and fair wages.  The company has seen its peak, probably, but doesn't feel like it is sinking.  Hopefully they can maintain competitiveness and continue innovating.
cons: It is a large company and it is really easy to be simply a number and not be recognized for effort.  You really have to play politics and fight for recognition.

headline: Disappointing, as company is no longer investing in us.
pros: Large company, good benefits, relatively high pay
cons: Upper management is not familiar or comfortable with software-based products, especially embedded products. Also, management is short-term focused and not really willing to invest in people. They would much rather invest in new companies.

headline: Great company
pros:
Job security (as a product builder)
Lots of Vacation time
Friendly supervisors (I've had at least 5)
Diversity of employees
cons:
Lots of 6 day workweeks (rarely 7)
Can be difficult to get the exact days off you want (only a certain amount of people per line)

headline: Good Company
pros: Great product that helps people around the world. A sense of satisfaction that comes from improving the lives of others.
cons: Extremely fast paced division. Many late nights spent at the office just trying to stay afloat on projects and tasks.

headline: Very disappointing.
pros: you might be interested to try this company as an intern, but this is it. You can get familiar with medical devices, firmware and software development, testing and releases. But this is it.
cons: Right now there is no particular reason you'd like to join this company. Layoffs are happening twice a year, sometimes they are silent - you can only find out about it when somebody from coworkers will tell you. The management is self-centric and incompetent.

headline: The place is shrinking
pros:
Products that save lives - heart products and catheters
Strong Quality Focus- all across organization
Nice building - parking is free
cons:
Absent Management
No clear directions
Layoffs - constant rounds of downsizing
Too much dependence on corporate, for any direction - no ability to make decision

headline: Positive
pros: Good Compensation.  Good ability to reward employees.
cons: Limited ability for career advancement.

headline: Boston Scientific is a great place to work, the management is supportive, and we have passionate dedicated colleagues
pros: Boston Scientific provides its employees strong benefits, flexible schedule, strong product line, great staff.  It is a very enjoyable place to go to wrork
cons: Relatively flat, lean structure which leads to less opportunities for promotion.

headline: 'salright
pros: Money is good. Very flexible hours (if you're a developer).
cons: Poor management. No real career growth.

headline: Not bad
pros: Great company, great products. Good future to this company
cons: Good and timely decisions are required.

headline: Outsourcing is a symptom
pros: Knowing that you are directly or indirectly helping very sick people.  Providing tools for brilliant doctors to work magic.
cons: This is a hyper political company whose culture was changed over night by the FDA warning letter.  There is a real fear of changing anything in case the change doesn't work out.  Nobody wants to make a decision so the company has become paralized with fear.  The reason that most functions were outsourced to India and China was because they couldn't work well in BSC.  There is very little cost savings.  As bad as outsourcing to Asia is, it's still better than what BSC could do on their own.  Why else would they get rid of so many good workers?  (Full disclosure - I left on my own for a better job and was not whacked in the RIF).

headline: Staff and managers are excited about their jobs, and very enjoyable to work with.
pros: Interesting, supportive environment to work. Sr management is accessible. Focus on quality, and continuous improvement.
cons: In my area relatively little opportunity for career growth.

headline: Feels like a daily bullying
pros: Fellow workers are decent human beings and are great to work with!!! keep up the great work.
cons: Supervisors in gway have to much power intrusted to them.be afraid to be disliked by one ,it may cost you your job.two years of bliss under a realy easy going gentleman to fearing for my job now with another...taraget sheets that are against line clearance used to gather information for management...sweat shop worker pops to mind even though i achive taragets put in front of me i feel it stops me getting promoted to the job i feel id do good at.

headline: It allowed me to grow professionally, and be a part of growing technologies to enhance and save lives.
pros: great people, state of the art technologies, wide range of products
cons: senior management not always in touch with the needs of physicians or customers

headline: Boston Scientific is a good place to work
pros: BSC was a company that seemed to respect it's employees, seemed to be very flexible about accommodating my family's schedule, and had a very friendly atmosphere.
cons: During my time at BSC, it seemed like there was a lot of miscommunication and/or lack of communication when projects involved more than one department.     This would result in a lot of unneeded anxiety, stress, and after-hours work.

headline: BSC doesn't have any idea how to implement their plans and do so without consulting the employees impacted.
pros: here is a long tradition of some great products at Boston Legacy as well as Guidant.
cons: Their main hope is to be bought by J&J. BSC is working hard at destroying the Guidant CRM legacy. Vertical Communication is horrible.

headline: if you have a heart for the medical device industry
pros: Ability to be part of a company that makes products that save and improve people's lives. Excellent benefits and competitive pay. Chance to work with many intelligent people.
cons: Some procedures that are counterproductive and required learning that may be irrelevant or redundant within certain jobs. Could use more local IT support.

headline: Good place to work
pros: BSC makes compelling products, and management is pretty forward thinking of late about using the best technology possible.  I've had great options for career advancement and feel like I'm part of a solid team.
cons: It's a very large company - this is both a blessing and a curse.  There have been movements to use offshore teams more in the last 4 years.

headline: Get the experience you need and move on.
pros: Very competitive benefits, onsite learning opportunities, certain departments hire from within, they take chances on new college graduates, great education reimbursement, some flexible working schedules (depends on what department you are in)
cons: In less than 3 years of my career there have been multiple layoffs and rumors of future layoffs and outsourcing.  Typical corporate atmosphere where their best solution to the political and economic climate is to layoff and/or outsource while senior leadership makes millions in compensation (CEO compensation is a matter of public record.  Look it up).  There was a major discrepancy in workload for my department, and noticeable favoritism.  People who continued to slack off experienced no apparent repercussions while those who worked efficiently were rewarded with more work.  Those who carry the workload do so to the point of exhaustion and frustration, with no end in site.  The culture is reactive versus proactive.  Due to the size of the company, any changes made have to go through so much bureaucratic red tape that by the time the changes comes, nobody can remember the point.  Collectively, this all has resulted in a loss of top talent to other companies.

headline: Low morale, poor management, out of date systems
pros: In my department employee are treated like incompetent criminals. The level of micromanagement is unbelievable! Part of this problem probably stems that supervisors have little to no management experience or training. Drama, office politics and spite are the name of the game.  Morale is very low and attitudes are correspondingly bad. Systems are clunky and out-of-date and employee suggestions are ignored.  I’ve seen colleges work 12-hour days for months on end and get reprimanded for not doing enough work. If you are a hard worker you are awarded with more work and no recognition or praise. Overall, my department contains a good deal of talented, highly educated professionals but it feels like junior high. Very high turn-over.  Maybe other departments are better!
cons: Employees treated with little respect, office politics, miserable people, no growth, managers with no training, no work-life balance, micromanagement, out-of-date job tools

headline: its a coprorate atmoshpere
pros: well run, large company, lots of capital
cons: bureaucratic, can be a bit of a drain

headline: Too Bad its closing
pros:
Good place to work and develop
Good systems in place to drive lean production
Good Quality Systems and principle based manufacturing
cons:
Looking to shrink on cost structure far more than increasing sales
Divesting Miami site to Costa Rica 
Laid off all Miami employees effective 2012

headline: It's been a roller coaster of building and improving followed by focus on cost reductions, RIFs, and outsourcing.
pros: The corporate makes a lot of good products that make an important difference in the quality of patient lives.  The simple mission statement: " I improve the quality of patient care and all things Boston Scientific."
cons: Debt maintenance from past acquisitions (purchasing of Guidant at all costs) with its long term impact on business performance as well as the resulting preoccupation with cost reductions. Willingness to eliminate/outsource QA jobs after the FDA Corporate warning letter was lifted. Increased outsourcing of US jobs.

headline: Good company, good mission
pros: Patient interaction, good benefits, help people, innovative medical device
cons: Slow advancement, no defined career path for some positions

headline: Conflicting Cultures
pros: Good product line.  Good talent if properly engaged
cons: Moving toward mediocrity  through the combination of CRM and CV

headline: Boston Scientific is more committed to its shareholders than to its employees and customers.
pros: Boston Scientific is engaged in bringing innovative medical products to market.  They have been a leader in the areas of stent production and heart rhythm devices (defibrillators and pacemakers).  This means that the work you do as a member of the company directly improves the lives of individuals.  The annual Quality Day event showcases specific patients and their families in a way that brought tears to my eyes every time I saw how the technologies I worked on helped people in very tangible ways.
cons: Boston Scientific has become increasingly focused on cost reduction through outsourcing key functions (IT, R&D, manufacturing).  This has resulted in a series of layoffs over the past 4 years.  The result has been devastating to both the people laid off and the people remaining behind as the survivors have seen workloads increase and financial resources shrink.

headline: Challenging and satisfactory but quite demanding
pros: Excellent pay and benefits. If you excel, there are promotions available.
cons: If you don't excel, promotions are not likely. Like most companires, there is a lot of politics to deal with.

headline: Great training ground
pros: Dynamic industry with exposure to multiple business facets
cons: Healthcare company struggling to find an identity

headline: Good place to start career
pros: Engaging work. Good work/life balance. Overall positive experience.
cons: Very structured promotions. Need more people.

headline: Not a bad place to work
pros: Educated workforce is a great benefit to work here. Work environment is casual and work life balance is very good.
cons: Managers are always micromanaging which is very disruptive to the employees. Not very good salary and bonuses so this hard.

People, people, people
industry

caring
